subject: Art & Design
title: Cinematography: Painting With Light
description: A micro-lesson that makes Cinematography: Painting With Light usable.

hook.text: Roger Deakins lit a war scene in 1917 to look like one continuous shot at golden hour. It took months of planning.

buildup.text: Cinematography is the art of capturing images on camera: framing, movement, lens choice, and lighting.

discovery.text: The cinematographer (DP) translates the director's vision into visual language. Every shadow is intentional.

twist.text: Digital cameras changed the craft. DPs can now monitor color and exposure in real time, not after development.

climax.text: The best cinematography serves the story invisibly. You feel the mood without knowing why.

punchline.text: Cinematography is writing with light, shadow, and movement.

quiz.question: What does a cinematographer (DP) do?
options: Translates the director's vision into visual images through camera and light
Edits the final cut of the film
